New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder extended their win streak to a franchise-record 13 in a row.
Key Match Events: The Thunder suffocated the Clippers with a decisive 27-7 run filled with LA turnovers and struggling to produce quality shots.
The Thunder outscored the Clippers in the third quarter 42-20 to completely flip the scoreboard.
The Thunder shot 50% from the field and went 14-of-38 (36.8%) from 3.
Post-Match Reflections: The depleted Clippers were light work for Gilgeous-Alexander. He didn't need to go at full speed to put them away. Instead, OKC only needed one monster quarter to escape with another win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder had 29 assists on 43 baskets. Four Thunder players scored double-digit points.
Gilgeous-Alexander finished with 14 points in the first half but exploded for 15 in the third quarter.
Amir Coffey led the way with 26 points on 10-of-14 shooting and went 6-of-8 from 3.
Others: The Thunder will play against the New York Knicks on the second night of this back-to-back.
The Clippers struggled without Kawhi Leonard and James Harden.
